meanings.definition: The act of carving or engraving designs on whalebone or ivory.
meanings.sent1: She learned scrimshawing from her grandfather, who was a skilled artist.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed beautiful scrimshawing pieces made by talented craftsmen.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be scrimshawing experts, using sticks to carve patterns in the sand.
meanings.sent4: His intricate scrimshawing on the ivory pendant told a story of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The art of scrimshawing requires patience and precision to create intricate designs.

meanings.definition: The practice of creating decorative objects from whalebone or ivory by carving or engraving.
meanings.sent1: The sailors passed the time at sea by scrimshawing small trinkets to sell at ports.
meanings.sent2: Scrimshawing was a traditional craft among the indigenous tribes of the Arctic.
meanings.sent3: The shop owner proudly displayed his collection of scrimshawing artifacts in the window.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for scrimshawing led her to open a small studio to teach others the art.
meanings.sent5: The intricate scrimshawing on the ivory tusk depicted scenes of hunting and fishing.
